review: I am not sure if i got a bad one or not. I have both chromecast and the firestick.  The firestick constantly pixelates movies and stops responding and sometimes takes forever for things to load. I dont have this problem with chromecast so its not my internet speed.  I use it for hulu amazon prime hbo go netflix and slingtv and disney jr for my granddaughter. if i could get another one to see if its just a bad stick i would be happy to change the review. but i wont be buying another one for the other tvs

review: I own the Fire TV box and wanted this to take on the road while I traveled for work.  I bought it on the road and it didn't work in the hotel from the hotel's wifi as advertised, but all it needed was a quick software update.  I paired it with the hotspot on my phone, downloaded the update and then switched to the hotel's wifi.  Worked like a charm after that.  If you're buying this to use in a hotel, make sure to download any updates from home, before hitting the road.
author: Kdub

review: I am returning this. I was extremely frustrated almost from the get go. It was very easy to set up, even for someone as non-tech savvy as me. I admit I do not totally understand apps and whatnot, but I was exasperated to learn that the "free" app usually come with a monthly fee in order to get of the programming. My TV needs are very, very limited, and I also did not like all the extra garbage advertised when you start the fire stick. All I wanted was something simple to replace satellite that would allow me to view ABC, NBC, CBS, PBS and classic TV. This was too much and too big of a hassle.
